meanings.definition: To make something more dense or tightly packed.
meanings.sent1: She is compacting the soil in the garden to make it firm for planting.
meanings.sent2: The workers are compacting the trash in the dumpster to fit more garbage.
meanings.sent3: The kids were compacting the sand into small molds to build sandcastles.
meanings.sent4: The chef was compacting the dough to make perfectly shaped cookies.
meanings.sent5: The machine was compacting the paper into neat bundles for recycling.

meanings.definition: The process of reducing the size or volume of something by compressing or squeezing it.
meanings.sent1: The compacting of the files saved a lot of storage space on the computer.
meanings.sent2: The compacting of the clothes in the suitcase made it easier to close.
meanings.sent3: The compacting of the snowball made it perfect for a snowball fight.
meanings.sent4: The compacting of the garbage in the truck helped reduce the number of trips to the dump.
meanings.sent5: The compacting of the boxes made them easier to stack in the warehouse.
